meanings.sent1: She winterises her garden by covering delicate plants with mulch.
meanings.sent2: He winterises his car by checking the antifreeze and changing to winter tires.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel winterises its nest with extra leaves for warmth.
meanings.sent4: The old house was winterised with new insulation to keep out the cold.
meanings.sent5: The farmer winterises the barn by sealing any gaps to keep the animals cozy.

meanings.definition: To make (something) suitable for winter use.
meanings.sent1: They winterise their cabin by stocking up on firewood and warm blankets.
meanings.sent2: The ski resort winterises the slopes by grooming them for snow sports.
meanings.sent3: The family winterises their camping gear for a chilly outdoor adventure.
meanings.sent4: The company winterised the outdoor equipment for the upcoming cold season.
meanings.sent5: The park ranger winterises the trails by marking them clearly for winter hikers.

meanings.definition: To protect (something) from the effects of winter.
meanings.sent1: She winterises her pipes by insulating them to prevent freezing.
meanings.sent2: The gardener winterises the delicate flowers by covering them with a frost cloth.
meanings.sent3: The birds winterise their nests with extra twigs to shield from the cold.
meanings.sent4: The city winterised the roads by salting them to prevent ice buildup.
meanings.sent5: The homeowner winterises the windows with weather stripping to keep out drafts.
